A quick note about easiest way for me, if XP is installed after Vista, which overwrites Vista's bootsector with such calling NTLDR.  

Some wise, always helpful and famous guy, made a very handy script ![:tabletalk:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/tabletalk.gif):  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=2362](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=2362 "External link")  

Copy Vista's bootmgr to VSLDR for example in C\\.  
makeBS c:\\VSLDR /a "Start Vista"  

Done ![:thumbsup:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/thumbsup.gif)

What does a boot manager do different?

forumNotes.author: paraglider
forumNotes.content: A boot manager allows you to hide / unhide primary partitions at boot time so that you can select what primary partition to boot. It may also allow the disk numbers to be reordered so a second physical disk appears as the first disk. It will also do other things as well.If you want to boot a BartPE partition from the not first primary partition on a disk then you will need a boot manager.

forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content: And a boot manager should be OS-independent. An OS crash should not fail the boot manager. This is not the case of Vista bootmgr where if this file is missing/deleted, the file system is broken, partition not active etc... then you cannot boot other OSes including Vista itself.

forumNotes.author: wendy
forumNotes.content:
Vista trashed my 2K boot-loader, so now i load vista through the 2k boot loader.  

It's simple.  

1. use bootpart to create a boot-sector for Windows Vista  
2. use bootpart to make the system boot to Windows XP  
3. restore ntldr and ntdetect.com to the root directory
